metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1308 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: kde-workspace 4.2.0 and plasma-workspace before 5.1.95 allows remote attackers to obtain input events, and consequently obtain passwords, by leveraging access to the X server when the screen is locked.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> under X, apps can pretty much sniff input events anyway tsimonq2> The only release that is affected by this is Trusty, and upstream recommends against backporting a fix (it's low priority anyways) Reference: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1183710#c5

criterions.comment: kde-workspace: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
